programme.desc: The Deception Verification: Leonard returns early from his research expedition as a surprise for Penny, but Sheldon becomes upset that he wasn't in on the secret.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A God-Fearin' Baptist and a Hot Trophy Husband: George and Mary insist on meeting the new woman in Georgie's life.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Uncle Sheldon and a Hormonal Firecracker: Despite the whole family trying to keep it a secret, Sheldon and Missy learn about Georgie's pregnancy.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Brand new series: In a MAFS Aus first, the experts have rematched both members of an original couple. Awhina returns home after a busy day - to find the apartment empty.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Citation Negation: Sheldon and Amy get some devastating news. Bernadette asks Stuart's girlfriend Denise to teach her how to beat Howard at a video game.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The VCR Illumination: Sheldon and Amy are still upset about their theory being disproven, but a video tape from Sheldon's past inspires him not to give up.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Paintball Scattering: Jealousy, trust issues and tension among the couples in the gang cause mayhem when Penny and Leonard organise a paintball game.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Tougher Nut and a Note on File: Sheldon's search for a comic leads to a breakthrough. Georgie and Mandy have an uncomfortable first encounter with her parents.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Legalese and a Whole Hoo-Ha: Sheldon's database invention puts him at odds with the university. And the church takes issue with Meemaw's video store.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Up All Night: Gloria isn't happy with Jay's reaction to the arrival of Javier, Manny's infamously unreliable dad. Phil is suffering from kidney stones.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Fifteen Percent: Mitchell seeks revenge when Jay introduces Cameron as just his 'friend'. Gloria gives Manny's date a makeover.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lost Verizon: When Bart finds Denis Leary's phone and uses it to make prank calls and accept job offers, Denis comes up with a creative punishment for him.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Double, Double, Boy in Trouble: Bart switches places with his doppelganger, Simon, and discovers that Simon's wealthy family are plotting against him.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Stockholm Syndrome: Howard and Bernadette go on a trip without their children, Leonard and Penny try to keep a secret, and Raj makes a new friend.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Pilot: The first ever episode of the hit sitcom. Leonard and Sheldon's geeky world is shaken up by the arrival of a beautiful new neighbour.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Big Bran Hypothesis: Sheldon sneaks into Penny's flat to tidy it. She's not happy about it.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brother from Another Series: Sideshow Bob (guest star Kelsey Grammer) is once again released from prison, into the care of his respectable brother Cecil (David Hyde Pierce).

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - The Man from G.R.A.M.P.A.: A British secret agent comes to Springfield on the trail of a Russian spy. Guest starring Stephen Fry.

programme.title: New: Married at First Sight...
programme.desc: ...Australia: Brand new series: At the third dinner party, Eliot and Lauren meet for the first time since their short-lasting marriage. Awhina confronts Adrian about leaving.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: This time on the box, I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here!, Miriam and Alan: Lost in Scotland, Tiger King 2, Inside Beverly Hills: The Land of the Rich and Famous, and more.

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: On Gogglebox this time: Strictly Come Dancing, Selling Sunset, Mariah's Christmas: The Magic Continues, True Story, How to Make It on OnlyFans and ITV News (No.10 Xmas Party).

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Skyla's cleaning business leaves her too busy for a man. Is her sparkly someone in the pods? Bisexual trans man Zeus is just dipping his toe into dating... can he find the one?

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Brand new series: At the third dinner party, Eliot and Lauren meet for the first time since their short-lasting marriage. Awhina confronts Adrian about leaving the experiment.

programme.title: Rick and Morty [adult swim]
programme.desc: Rickmancing the Stone: Rick takes Morty and Summer on a jaunt to a Mad Max-style universe where he tries to steal a green crystal from a group of scavengers.

programme.title: New: Common Side Effects
programme.desc: (adult swim) Brand new series - Amelia & Wyatt: Marshall finds himself in a new situation that changes everything, leading him to reunite with an old friend and start a new plan. (Ep8)

programme.title: New: Love Triangle UK
programme.desc: Brand new series: Vogue Williams hosts, as the love triangles reunite to look back on their incredible highs and lows. And as old feuds re-ignite, there's one final showdown...

programme.title: Abbott Elementary
programme.desc: Teacher Conference: Gregory and Janine bond at the Pennsylvania Educational Conference, while Jacob is charmed by teachers from a rival school.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry Goldberg's Day Off: Inspired by the film Ferris Bueller's Day Off, Barry pretends to be ill so he can avoid school and create an epic day of his own.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Happy Mom, Happy Life: Dana and Adam are given a doll to parent for a class assignment, but their project is compromised when Beverly keeps interfering.

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Welcome to the Commercial: Calvin asks Dave, Tina and Marty to help him film a TV ad for his business.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mother Tucker: Cameron loves his mum, so Mitchell isn't sure how to tell Cam that she makes him uncomfortable. When Haley breaks up with Dylan, Phil takes it harder than anyone.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: After the Fire: The Pritchetts rally for a good cause after a neighbour's house burns down, but there's a downside to their Samaritan intentions when Jay throws out his back.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Punkin Chunkin: When an old neighbourhood kid returns to town as a hugely successful internet billionaire, it gets Phil thinking of what could have been.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: A short, cheeky clip from Rude Tube's naughty little sister Rude(ish) Tube, featuring sheep.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: PJ's Steakhouse: In New York, Gordon Ramsay visits PJ's Steakhouse, where owners Joe and Madalyn are in serious debt and struggling to keep the high-end restaurant afloat.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Pygmoelian: After he's snubbed for a Duff beer calendar, Moe goes for plastic surgery and ends up so handsome that he becomes a soap star.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart to the Future: Bart foresees his adult future as a struggling rock guitarist crashing on Ralph Wiggum's couch, while Lisa becomes President.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Scavenger Vortex: Raj organises an epic and demanding scavenger hunt, designed to test the friends' scientific knowledge and common sense.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Raiders Minimization: Amy ruins one of Sheldon's favourite films by pointing out a flaw in the storyline. Raj and Stuart decide to create online dating profiles.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: White Trash, Holy Rollers and Punching People: The Coopers face judgement from the congregation in the wake of Georgie's pregnancy.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: A Clogged Pore, a Little Spanish and the Future: While Sheldon struggles to cope with the first signs of puberty, his parents both hunt for new jobs.

programme.title: Married at First Sight Australia
programme.desc: Brand new series: At the third dinner party, Eliot and Lauren meet for the first time since their short-lasting marriage. Awhina confronts Adrian about leaving the experiment.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Propagation Proposition: Penny's ex-boyfriend Zack and his wife want a baby, but when they encounter fertility problems, they ask Leonard for his help.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Confirmation Polarization: Sheldon and Amy are thrilled when their super-asymmetry theory is proved correct. Bernadette enjoys some big success at work.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Meteorite Manifestation: Sheldon is thrilled to help Howard and Bernadette with some bureaucratic paperwork, until he realises they are breaking the law.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: College Dropouts and the Medford Miracle: Sheldon considers dropping out of college to focus on building his database.

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.desc: Pancake Sunday and Textbook Flirting: Mary struggles to make new friends while Mandy pushes Georgie to date another woman.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Moon Landing: Claire feels slightly inadequate when her old friend, Valerie (guest star Minnie Driver), visits and is nothing like Claire remembered.

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: My Funky Valentine: Phil and Claire break from their traditional Valentine's Day dinner date and plan a little role play excursion. And Jay and Gloria's ideas of romance clash.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Dangerous Curves: Homer and Marge head to a log cabin for the weekend and reminisce about their early courtship.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Lisa Exchange Cross Words: Lisa discovers that she has a knack for crosswords and enters a tournament. But Homer thinks he can make money by betting on her to lose.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Fuzzyboots Corollary: Leonard is upset when he discovers that Penny is seeing someone, so he plucks up the courage to ask a woman out on a date.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Luminous Fish Effect: Getting fired forces Sheldon to ponder life outside physics, so Leonard has to take drastic action to snap his friend out of his reverie.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The Hamburger Postulate: Leonard thinks he's been wasting his time on Penny, so he turns his attention to Leslie. Sheldon's uncomfortable with a change to his hamburger routine.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: My Sister, My Sitter: Lisa starts a new career as a babysitter. All is going well, until Marge and Homer employ her to look after Bart and Maggie...

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Brand new series - The Last Barfighter: A secret society of bartenders seek vengeance on Homer and his friends after Moe breaks their most sacred rule.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Italian Bob: On a trip to Italy to find Mr Burns a new sports car, the Simpsons get stranded in a village where Sideshow Bob reigns as mayor.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Simpson Christmas Stories: Homer shares his version of Jesus's birth, Grampa tells a Yuletide war story, and Springfield prepares for Christmas.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer's Paternity Coot: The Simpsons receive a long-lost letter, which suggests that Homer's biological father is actually British treasure hunter Mason Fairbanks.

programme.title: The Inbetweeners Movie
programme.desc: (2011) Comedy with Simon Bird, Joe Thomas, Blake Harrison and James Buckley. School is over, so the boys celebrate with an outrageous lads holiday in Crete.

programme.title: Brussels, My Love?

programme.title: Rocketman
programme.desc: (2019) Taron Egerton is Elton John in Dexter Fletcher's sequins-and-all biopic musical drama. With Jamie Bell as lyricist Bernie Taupin and Stephen Graham as Dick James.

programme.title: Flight
programme.desc: (2012) Drama with Denzel Washington. A hard-drug-using airline pilot lands a plane in a heroically spectacular way. But a blood test reveals that he was high in more ways than one...

programme.title: London Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2016) All-out action as Gerard Butler returns as US Secret Service agent Mike Banning in the second instalment of the Has Fallen franchise. Mike and POTUS get in a pickle in London.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: (1952) John Wayne stars in John Ford's comedy as a US boxer, retired to Ireland, who courts the fiery Mary Kate (Maureen O'Hara), despite her brother's (Victor McLaglen) violent objections.

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder
programme.desc: (1965) Western. John Wayne stars as John Elder, the oldest of four brothers who are out to avenge the murder of their mother. With Dean Martin and Dennis Hopper.

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: (1959) Fantasy adventure starring James Mason, Pat Boone and Diane Baker. An expedition to the centre of the planet unexpectedly encounters a villainous rival and prehistoric beasts.

programme.title: A Good Year
programme.desc: (2006) Romcom. Russell Crowe stars as a US stockbroker who intends to sell the French vineyard he has inherited. Then he meets a local waitress. With Marion Cotillard and Abbie Cornish.

programme.title: The Invitation
programme.desc: (2022) Gothic horror with Nathalie Emmanuel. A struggling New York artist discovers she has rich British relatives and accepts an invitation to a wedding in Whitby. Well, blood is blood.

programme.title: Beast
programme.desc: (2017) BAFTA-winning psychological thriller with Jessie Buckley and Johnny Flynn. A fragile young woman begins a potentially dangerous relationship with a mysterious outsider.

programme.title: Banel & Adama
programme.desc: (2023) Ramata-Toulaye Sy's drama with Khady Mane and Mamadou Diallo as a married couple with a complex backstory, whose happiness is about to be shaken by tribal expectation. In Pular/subs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: 23 Paces to Baker Street
programme.desc: (1956) Thriller starring Van Johnson as a blind playwright who overhears a kidnapping plot and, with his fiance (Vera Miles) and secretary (Cecil Parker), sets out to trap the villains.

programme.title: Comanche Station
programme.desc: (1960) A western from Budd Boetticher. A hero and an outlaw must work together to save a kidnapped woman from a band of warring Comanche. Starring Randolph Scott and Nancy Gates.

programme.title: Sink the Bismarck!
programme.desc: (1960) Second World War drama. Kenneth More stars as the British captain charged with finding and destroying the Bismarck, Germany's largest battleship. Directed by Lewis Gilbert.

programme.title: The Ghost and Mrs Muir
programme.desc: (1947) Supernatural romance starring Rex Harrison as the spirit of a gruff sea captain who haunts widow Gene Tierney, only for her to fall in love with him. Directed by Joseph L Mankiewicz.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: (1984) Musical drama with Kevin Bacon. An unruly teen moves to a small town where dancing is banned. As more teens start misbehaving, can he change his elders' minds? Violence.

programme.title: Copshop
programme.desc: (2021) Action thriller with Gerard Butler. A hitman gets himself arrested so that he can get to a bad guy who also got himself arrested to try and hide from the hitman.

programme.title: On the Road
programme.desc: (2012) Drama based on Jack Kerouac's novel with Sam Riley. A young American writer hits the road in 1947 in search of poetry, parties and sex. With Kristen Stewart and Elisabeth Moss.

programme.title: Race with the Devil
programme.desc: (1975) Horror thriller with Peter Fonda. Two holidaying couples disturb a ritual human sacrifice and must flee for their lives, pursued by the Satanists responsible.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: (1957) Drama with Rita Hayworth, Robert Mitchum and Jack Lemmon. Two friends agree to smuggle a mysterious European woman across the border, but she soon has them at each other's throats.

programme.title: The Fallen Idol
programme.desc: (1948) Adaptation of Graham Greene's story with Ralph Richardson and Bobby Henrey. A butler who is accused of murdering his wife, has only a schoolboy to fight his corner.

programme.title: Two Way Stretch
programme.desc: (1960) Comedy. Peter Sellers, Bernard Cribbins and David Lodge star as criminals happily incarcerated in a prison run like a home-from-home for old lags and rascals by a liberal governor.

programme.title: Fantastic Voyage
programme.desc: (1966) Classic sci-fi adventure. Raquel Welch and Donald Pleasence are among the crew of a miniaturised submarine that's injected into an injured diplomat's body in a bid to save his life.

programme.title: 10 Things I Hate About You
programme.desc: (1999) Teen comedy with Julia Stiles and Heath Ledger. A student is furious to discover her prom date was bribed by her sister to invite her. But confusion ensues when he falls for her.

programme.title: Ambulance
programme.desc: (2022) Michael Bay's high-octane thriller with Jake Gyllenhaal. A bodged heist sees two brothers try to evade the LAPD in a hospital wagon, as a paramedic operates on a cop in the back.

programme.title: Patriot Games
programme.desc: (1992) Thriller with Harrison Ford and Sean Bean. An ex-CIA agent foils an IRA assassination plot. But a vengeful IRA man follows him back to America.

programme.title: Rocketman
programme.desc: (2019) Taron Egerton is Elton John in Dexter Fletcher's sequins-and-all biopic musical drama. With Jamie Bell as lyricist Bernie Taupin and Stephen Graham as Dick James.

programme.desc: (2012) Drama with Denzel Washington. A hard-drug-using airline pilot lands a plane in a heroically spectacular way. But a blood test reveals that he was high in more ways than one...

programme.title: London Has Fallen
programme.desc: (2016) All-out action as Gerard Butler returns as US Secret Service agent Mike Banning in the second instalment of the Has Fallen franchise. Mike and POTUS get in a pickle in London.

programme.title: Brianna: A Mother's Story
programme.desc: The brutal murder of 16-year-old Brianna Ghey in a Warrington park shocked the nation. In this documentary, her mother Esther talks about her daughter, and how the tragedy has driven her fight for change. The film details the 28-hour search that led to the arrest of Brianna 15-year-old killers - Scarlett Jenkinson and Eddie Ratcliffe. Friends and family also talk about Brianna's trans journey, the struggles she faced, and the love she brought to those around her

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: There's more life-changing money on offer as Ant and Dec introduce NHS matrons Karis and Tim to the Limitless Ladder. They'd like to win a six-figure sum to buy a first home and help out their family and friends, but there's a huge surprise in store for them and a nerve-racking game to be played first. It's then husband and wife Arj and Charlotte's turn to climb the never-ending money ladder. Arj dreams of opening a restaurant one day, but can he make the dream a reality?

programme.title: The British Airways Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. A three-day long police interview of Robert Brown finally ended with a confession and the pilot leading officers to the site where Joanna Simpson was buried, a remote spot in Windsor Great Park. The trial that followed saw Brown deny murder with a defence of adjustment disorder due to diminished responsibility and 13 years on, he has served half his prison sentence and is due to be released. Can a high-profile campaign from Joanna's family keep him behind bars?

programme.title: The British Airways Killer
programme.desc: Part two of two. A three-day long police interview of Robert Brown finally ended with a confession and the pilot leading officers to the site where Joanna Simpson was buried, a remote spot in Windsor Great Park. The trial that followed saw Brown deny murder with a defence of adjustment disorder due to diminished responsibility and 13 years on, he has served half his prison sentence and is due to be released. Can a high-profile campaign from Joanna's family keep him behind bars?
